creator: nettings@apache.org
text:
it says "Deprecated. use DocumentInfoModule instead."
now page-envelope yields information about the *current document* by looking
into the request, where we have the document *URL*.
the DocumentInfoModule can provide all the information that page-envelope can,
but it needs a *UUID*. i don't have one.
how am i supposed to get it if i want to find out stuff about the current request?

The attribute in question is page-envelope:document-id. I've fixed the warning
message in r586109. I see this in use all over our xmaps.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
I'll submit a patch to clear up all of our internal code that uses the
deprecated property.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
I've switched document-id for document-uuid where I could in our source in
r586495. The code that was throwing the deprecation warning was identical
between document-id and document-uuid, with the exception of the former logging
the warning. This should eliminate the warning from the logs.
